subject: JUnit tests requiring j2ee.jar fail when running mvn surefire:test
msgSnippet: Hey, there! I m hoping someone on this end of the world can answer a question for me.  I tried posting this on the Maven mailing list but haven t gotten any
messageBody:
Hey, there!

I'm hoping someone on this end of the world can answer a question for
me. I tried posting this on the Maven mailing list but haven't
gotten any responses. I've got a JUnit 4.2 test that tests a simple
little email address validator. The validator uses
javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress. Everything works fine in Eclipse
when I run it as a JUnit Test. However, when I use maven to try and
install the project containing the JUnit test, the test fails on the
surefire:test with the following:

java.lang.ClassFormatError: Absent Code attribute in method that is
not native or abstract in class file
javax/mail/internet/AddressException.

Can anyone suggest what to do differently to make the JUnit test run
properly during the surefire:test?

Thanks much!
Derry
